You were sent to stop the thieves? Well, as you can see, they have already escaped.≺Prompt≻
Considering we know nothing of the thieves, it would be futile to send out a search party.≺Prompt≻
However, an adventurer such as yourself would have connections in many more places than we.≺Prompt≻
Inquire with the gardener. He is the only one who saw the thieves. He may tell you something of importance.≺Prompt≻
Inquire with the gardener. He is the only one who said he saw the thieves. He may tell you something that rings a bell.≺Prompt≻
Ah, I know you. You're that adventurer ≺Player Name≻. You want to know about the thieves that broke into the queen's chambers?≺Prompt≻
Well, I didn't see anything special. All I saw was two suspicious lookin' Elvaan. When I yelled at 'em, they ran off. That be all.≺Prompt≻
But I swear I seen me one before... The one with blue armor...≺Prompt≻
Chalvatot, what has happened in my mother's chambers?≺Prompt≻
When I went to give some water to the flowers, I passed by some Temple Guards.≺Prompt≻
I am so sorry, Your Highness! Last night, some thieves broke into the late queen's chambers!≺Prompt≻
And to make matters worse, the scoundrels are still on the loose! Oh, what has become of the once mighty Chateau d'Oraguille?≺Prompt≻
I--I do not know what to say...≺Prompt≻
I knew something was wrong when I found my mother's diary in a strange place...≺Prompt≻
Your Highness? You say you saw something out of the ordinary?≺Prompt≻
Chalvatot, something is amiss... Could you please come to my chambers later?≺Prompt≻
Farewell, ≺Multiple Choice (Player Gender)≻[Sir/Lady] ≺Player Name≻. May you find the thieves that disgraced our great kingdom.≺Prompt≻
Why, welcome back, ≺Player Name≻. I'm sure the lords of both knightly orders would like to hear your report right away.≺Prompt≻
So, the seal of Fei'Yin is broken... We must face the prospect of nether beasts laying siege this land, as did they two decades past.≺Prompt≻
Peculiar have been their actions of late, and now this... We must act swiftly.≺Prompt≻
Yes, but our obligation to the alliance denies unilateral deployment to lands abroad. Were not the Northlands reduced to ashes in wars of old?≺Prompt≻
This does not bode well. Vigilantly we watched that land, and still this comes to pass!≺Prompt≻
Yes, I am afraid you are right. Our eyes were on the comings and goings of Orcs, ignorant of the greater threat.≺Prompt≻
And how should we explain this to our allies? San d'Oria cannot become the laughingstock of the civilized world!≺Prompt≻
Are such words even necessary?≺Prompt≻
Prince Trion!≺Prompt≻
Before they hit us, let us hit them. A bold strike would hamper their momentum.≺Prompt≻
But, my prince! By sending troops into the Northlands, we expose ourselves to a certain degree of diplomatic liability...≺Prompt≻
Liability!? Fools! Are you all blind to this peril? The enemy approaches while we bicker!≺Prompt≻
Yes, Prince Trion... However, we should involve the king and Prince Pieuje in this decision.≺Prompt≻
Curilla, do you share the opinion of Halver and Rahal?≺Prompt≻
Yes, my prince. We know not the enemy's numbers. I believe the peril of rushing headlong into battle would be too great.≺Prompt≻
Indeed, word of the Shadow Lord's return was brought to us by adventurers, and is as yet unconfirmed.≺Prompt≻
And if it did happen to be true, all the knights of San d'Oria would not be enough. We must confer with the alliance, my prince!≺Prompt≻
Hmph. So be it! All this talk of diplomatic liability... There are people we must defend, and an enemy we must defeat. Naught matters but that simple truth!≺Prompt≻
In such times, where could Pieuje be going?≺Prompt≻
Prince Trion...≺Prompt≻
Hmm... We must make haste and decide upon policy for our kingdom. At any rate, the exploration of Fei'Yin is complete.≺Prompt≻
Much time may be needed before we reach a conclusion. Rest and prepare for other expeditions. And thank you for your dutiful service.≺Prompt≻
Ah, it is you, ≺Player Name≻. I was beginning to wonder who would be chosen for this next mission. You may proceed to the Audience Chamber.≺Prompt≻
Long have we awaited your arrival, ≺Player Name≻. Your assistance is required in a mission for the Kingdom.≺Prompt≻
Where is the king, you ask? His Highness has retired to his quarters for the day. Recently, he has not been in the best of health.≺Prompt≻

There is no need to be concerned with my father's condition. Now that Lightbringer has found its way back to San d'Oria, the king has begun to show great improvement. He should be back to his normal self within days.≺Prompt≻
Now as for the reason you were summoned here: the papsque has called upon you to perform an investigation. His Holiness should be here shortly.≺Prompt≻
I apologize for my tardiness.≺Prompt≻
I have assembled you all here today to report a grave new finding.≺Prompt≻
It seems as of late, a magical wall of sorts has been placed around San d'Oria.≺Prompt≻
A magical wall, you say?≺Prompt≻
And what is more, this barrier greatly resembles the one that was utilized during the Great War to protect Tavnazia from its enemies.≺Prompt≻
An “Elemental Barrier”... Quite odd... To my knowledge, only an heir to the Tavnazian throne would be able to procure such magic.≺Prompt≻
Rochefogne... That scoundrel is up to something.≺Prompt≻
However, what could his motives be? This magic wall--it has brought no harm to the Kingdom, has it?≺Prompt≻
While this is true, there are still many aspects to this phenomenon that we do not understand. I feel it may be unwise to come to any hasty conclusions.≺Prompt≻
Ah, and this is why you have requested the assistance of the adventurer ≺Player Name≻.≺Prompt≻

That is correct, Your Highness. To maintain such a wall, a medium is required at its center. While mediums differ depending on the type of magic used, I am positive that one is buried somewhere near San d'Oria.≺Prompt≻
And its location is?≺Prompt≻

With San d'Oria as the center, it can be assumed that three mediums have been buried. As far as I can ascertain, there would be one in each of the areas of Vollbow, Valdeaunia, and Norvallen...≺Prompt≻
If it were me, I would bury them somewhere an adventurer would be least likely to travel...but where would that be?≺Prompt≻
Your Holiness, it sounds as if you are quite skilled at burying things...≺Prompt≻
I-I... I have cast many a magic wall in my time. I am just calling on my past experience.≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻, you must take extreme caution if you happen to come across the mediums. They must be disengaged in the correct order, and my instincts tell me that a trap may be set.≺Prompt≻
Once again, the papsque has impressed us all with his extensive knowledge on the situation at hand.≺Prompt≻
Yes. Well, ≺Player Name≻ is one of San d'Oria's finest adventurers. I am certain that ≺Multiple Choice (Player Gender)≻[he/she] will locate the mediums and succeed in destroying them.≺Prompt≻
May the Goddess bless you with Her grace on your journey.≺Prompt≻

With that Rochefogne running about, we will be forced to postpone the Rites of Succession. We would not want another scene like at the coming-of-age ceremony. We have our father's health to think about.≺Prompt≻
However, if what he says is true, and he truly is the heir to the Marquisate, then that means we share the same blood...≺Prompt≻
That is correct, my brother.≺Prompt≻
Claidie! You know quite well that you are not allowed to interfere with these meetings.≺Prompt≻
Have you already forgotten? I have completed my coming-of-age ceremony. I have the right to attend.≺Prompt≻
She is correct...≺Prompt≻
Hah. I apologize, Claidie. Well, as long as you are present, let us hear your opinion on the situation at hand.≺Prompt≻
As Pieuje has just stated, Rochefogne is our uncle...our mother's younger brother.≺Prompt≻
That is, if you believe the scoundrel.≺Prompt≻
And that is the exact reason why it is necessary to sit down and discuss with him the matters before us.≺Prompt≻
His outburst at my coming-of-age ceremony has enlightened me unto a piece of San d'Oria's terrible past.≺Prompt≻
Watch what you say, Claidie. Not all of us here are of the royal family.≺Prompt≻
I have nothing to hide, Brother. During the Great War, the San d'Orian army led the beastman hordes to Tavnazia. San d'Oria used the Marquisate as a decoy.≺Prompt≻

However, that decision was an important turning point in the war. The gallant battle waged by the citizens of Tavnazia dealt a forceful blow to the beastman forces and gave us enough time to prepare our armies.≺Prompt≻
Yes, a turning point that meant the loss of thousands of innocent lives and the end of a proud nation.≺Prompt≻
Tavnazia was destroyed when the beastmen's secret weapon malfunctioned. Nothing, not even the beastmen themselves, were left after that calamity.≺Prompt≻

Then why do you not sit down with Rochefogne and tell him this? Why must you capture him without being sure of his motives? Am I to believe this is how the royal family deals with its problems?≺Prompt≻
Can you not remember what transpired at your coming-of-age ceremony? Rochefogne did not seem as if he wanted to sit down and chat over a cup of tea.≺Prompt≻
... There must have been some reason... Some reason he could not tell us at that time...≺Prompt≻
And that is why we must first capture him. Only then will we be able to clear up that which troubles our two sides.≺Prompt≻
All right, but I ask you to promise me one thing. Do not hurt Rochefogne when you capture him.≺Prompt≻
Hah. I will heed your wish. However, if he lays a hand on any of my knights, I will be forced to take action.≺Prompt≻
Yes, Brother. That is all I have to say.≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻, search out and destroy these “mediums” that the papsque mentioned earlier. Only by doing so will the Kingdom be safe from the treachery behind this fiendish plan.≺Prompt≻
Trion. I think it is time for us to call on the services of the “Cadavres des Corneilles.”≺Prompt≻
The “Cadavres des Corneilles”! Pieuje, are you mad!?≺Prompt≻
Think, my brother. If we allow Rochefogne to run about as he pleases, the consequences could be irreparable.≺Prompt≻
If ≺Player Name≻ is able to destroy the “Elemental Barrier,” we can be sure that Rochefogne will be near. If we make the first move, we may be able to capture him.≺Prompt≻
Hmmm... Then do as you wish.≺Prompt≻
I ask the same of you that I did my brothers. If you find Rochefogne, please do not harm him. He is trying to tell us something, I know it...≺Prompt≻
<Sigh> If this is how it is to be, then I must take things into my own hands...≺Prompt≻

His Majesty has taken quite ill over the past few days and is currently resting in his chambers. During his leave of absence from the throne, the two princes have taken his place. However, things should be running as smoothly as always.≺Prompt≻

The papsque is most certain that the objects in question will be found in the areas of Vollbow, Valdeaunia, and Norvallen. You must treat this matter with the utmost delicacy. We cannot afford to have foreign powers taking advantage of our situation.≺Prompt≻

Ah, ≺Player Name≻. I have already read through Coteaulepoint's report. The fact that Rochefogne's body has not turned up troubles me; however, I must commend you on your efforts in disabling the Elemental Barrier.≺Prompt≻
As for the remaining details of what happened...≺Prompt≻
How do you reply? ≺Selection Dialog≻Understood, Your Highness. Remaining details?≺Prompt≻
Excellent. You understand well the sensitive matters of the Kingdom.≺Prompt≻
Do not mock me, ≺Player Name≻. You know quite well what I am speaking of.≺Prompt≻

The existence of the “Cadavres des Corneilles” must remain a national secret. If news of this organization were to spread to the ears of the other nations, the consequences would be grave. And with our father as ill as he is...≺Prompt≻
Our father is feeling much better now. He should be returning to his proper position on the throne shortly.≺Prompt≻
The Rites of Succession are upon us. When the time comes, we will be once again calling upon your services. You are dismissed.≺Prompt≻
Pieuje, what has become of our younger sister?≺Prompt≻
She has shut herself up in our mother's garden...≺Prompt≻
Hmmm... She must realize that what we are doing is for the good of the Kingdom.≺Prompt≻
Trion...≺Prompt≻
What is it that troubles you, Pieuje?≺Prompt≻
What if... What if neither of us are worthy enough to draw forth Lightbringer?≺Prompt≻
Hah hah hah! Your petty worries and niggling prudence amuse me, Brother.≺Prompt≻
Fear not, as there are none more worthy than we.≺Prompt≻
...≺Prompt≻
Who goes there?≺Prompt≻
An Orc? Why would an Orc be here? Hello? Is anyone around?≺Prompt≻
The “Cadavres des Corneilles”!?≺Prompt≻
So the Orcs have made it this far. Not surprising, with the magical wall being destroyed... This forces us to change our plans.≺Prompt≻
Why, you dirty scoundrel! Leave this place at once! You have no right being here!≺Prompt≻
I apologize, Your Highness. However, I ask a moment of your time to talk...≺Prompt≻
You wish to talk...with me?≺Prompt≻
Who... Who are you?≺Prompt≻

With the recovery of the royaulais, the Rites of Succession will soon be upon us. The preparations for such an important ceremony will create many sleepless nights for those of us working here in the chateau.≺Prompt≻
Rochefogne was slain? If it was not one of the Royal Knights, then... No, it is not possible...≺Prompt≻
I have heard the rumors of the fate of Rochefogne. However, I will not believe he is dead until I have seen the body with my own eyes.≺Prompt≻
The Rites of Succession... At last our new leader will be chosen...≺Prompt≻
We have increased the guard for the Rites of Succession twofold. We do not wish a repeat of the fiasco caused by Rochefogne at the coming-of-age ceremony.≺Prompt≻
I still feel responsible for letting the scoundrel near His Majesty. However, were it not for the events of that day, we would not be in our present position.≺Prompt≻
I still lack the judgment to know what is truth, and what is merely a lie...≺Prompt≻
I see you have all arrived. Now all we have is to wait for Claidie.≺Prompt≻
Ah, how is he? How is Rochefogne?≺Prompt≻
He is still unconscious. While the blow missed his vital organs, he has still sustained a great deal of damage. The doctors have told me that all we could do is watch and pray...≺Prompt≻
I see... Then we must wait until we may ask any more questions. However, I have just learned that the role of Lightbringer in the Rites of Succession was conceived by the papsque himself...≺Prompt≻
He lied to us about the true inscription on the stone tablet. The true inscription speaks of how the sword must be protected at all times and must never be drawn.≺Prompt≻
Why would the papsque fabricate such untruths?≺Prompt≻
The papsque had come to believe that Lightbringer was the key to the Gates of Paradise. It seems as if the Archduke of Jeuno's brother, Eald'narche, led him to believe this...≺Prompt≻
Because the sword can only be drawn by a member of the royal family, His Holiness conceived the Rites of Succession.≺Prompt≻
So the ceremony was a farce...?≺Prompt≻
It cannot be true...≺Prompt≻
We shall never know the full extent of the papsque's ambition, but just like us, he was lured by the awesome power that Lightbringer harbors in its blade.≺Prompt≻
Then what...is Lightbringer?≺Prompt≻
Right now, all we can believe is what Rochefogne has told us.≺Prompt≻
Lightbringer is the weapon that laid waste to Tavnazia...≺Prompt≻
Whatever the case, we cannot afford to let the beastmen attempt to use it, even if it takes the dispatch of every last soldier in San d'Oria.≺Prompt≻
Father, let me take command of the army.≺Prompt≻
Trion...?≺Prompt≻
I am to blame for the loss of Lightbringer. The responsibility of retrieving it lies within me.≺Prompt≻

I was the one who ignored Claidie's pleas to attempt negotiations with Rochefogne. If it were not for my foolish pride, none of this would ever have been brought upon San d'Oria! Father! Allow me the chance to redeem myself!≺Prompt≻
Curb your conceit, Trion!≺Prompt≻
Father...!?≺Prompt≻
Trion, you are simply dancing on the stage of destiny. It is time for you to come down and face reality.≺Prompt≻
Father...≺Prompt≻
I will command the army.≺Prompt≻
Trion, you will stand on the front lines and show the knights the true honor and valor of the d'Oraguille family.≺Prompt≻
Pieuje, you will maintain the supply routes, providing constant support to the front line and your brother.≺Prompt≻
Claidie, you will tend to Rochefogne, as well as watch over him. He has yet to win my trust.≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻, after this display, you must think the royal family pitiful. However, I have one last request of you. I wish you to stand on the front lines with Trion.≺Prompt≻
And finally, we must not forget that we must be faithful to the citizens of this kingdom. We stand on the foundation they built. We must not lose their trust.≺Prompt≻
Your Highness! One of our scouts has returned! The Orcs carrying Lightbringer have been spotted entering the Qu'Bia Arena!≺Prompt≻
Good work. Tell the scout to rest from his journey.≺Prompt≻
I order all our soldiers to Fei'Yin! And tell them that the fate of San d'Oria rides on their bravery!≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻! We can count on your assistance in our country's time of need, can we not? This is no longer a matter that can be handled by the royal family alone!≺Prompt≻
In the years I have served as a Royal Knight, I have been sent on many missions. However, this expedition to Fei'Yin means much more to me than most have.≺Prompt≻
I dedicate this battle to the knights I have lost. I will not let the blood they shed go in vain. We will defeat our enemies!≺Prompt≻
It is time for the Temple Knights and the Royal Knights to put their differences aside for the good of the Kingdom. We must retrieve Lightbringer at all costs!≺Prompt≻
Let this battle once again bring glory to the Temple Knights!≺Prompt≻
Prince Trion has departed for Fei'Yin. May the grace of the Goddess bring victory to the knights of the Kingdom!≺Prompt≻
Prince Pieuje has left with the expedition to Fei'Yin. I can only pray for his safety.≺Prompt≻
Prince Trion has returned safely and is currently awaiting your arrival in the Audience Chamber.≺Prompt≻
Prince Pieuje has returned without injury and is awaiting your arrival in the Audience Chamber.≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻! I never doubted your ability on the front line. We are truly in your debt. Proceed to the Audience Chamber. His Highness awaits!≺Prompt≻
I have heard of your valiant efforts from my son. It would not be an understatement to say that your repeated bravery has helped maintain peace throughout the Kingdom.≺Prompt≻
As for Lightbringer, as long as Rochefogne remains unconscious...≺Prompt≻
Your Highness!≺Prompt≻
Ah, Rochefogne. Claidie has kept me informed on your condition. How are you feeling?≺Prompt≻
I am in debt to your fine daughter for all she has done for me.≺Prompt≻
Your Highness... Allow me to apologize for all the trouble I have caused you and your kingdom.≺Prompt≻

You do so much resemble your sister... Forgive me. We all thought you had perished during the Great War. If I had only known that you were the true Rochefogne, we might have been able to prevent the loss of so many lives.≺Prompt≻
Your Highness...≺Prompt≻
You may rise, Rochefogne. As much as I would like to reminisce of times past, I first wish to know of Lightbringer.≺Prompt≻
Certainly.≺Prompt≻

Long ago, the Dragon King, Ranperre, entrusted the Tavnazian Marquisate with the duty of protecting Lightbringer. All members of the royal family learn of this duty during their coming-of-age ceremony.≺Prompt≻
So our mother knew as well?≺Prompt≻
Yes, my sister knew of Lightbringer. She also knew that the pollen of the dreamrose had the ability to temporarily neutralize the power of the blade.≺Prompt≻
So the pollen I threw... My mother left it in her will for such circumstances!≺Prompt≻
However, while we knew of our duty, none in Tavnazia knew the true power of an unsheathed Lightbringer. We were simply told to never draw the mighty blade.≺Prompt≻
But when the beastman forces made their way to our castle gates...≺Prompt≻
On that fateful day when the beastmen had taken the city, my family made an attempt to escape to San d'Oria.≺Prompt≻
However, being young and proud, I could not stand and watch as my country was engulfed in the flames of war. I seized Lightbringer from my father and headed back to the castle.≺Prompt≻
I never even made it to the city gates... The Orcs surrounded me, and that is when I drew Lightbringer from its sheath...≺Prompt≻
And the moment I did, I was engulfed in a brilliant light. I felt as if I were almighty...as if I were a god...≺Prompt≻
How long I stood there I do not remember. But when I came to, I was lying on a beach...and Lightbringer was nowhere to be found.≺Prompt≻
The man who rescued me from the sea told me how a great explosion had devastated Tavnazia, sending it deep underwater.≺Prompt≻
He said that people assumed the calamity was caused by an Orc weapon that had self-destructed, but due to the lack of evidence, no one would ever know.≺Prompt≻

The shock of the explosion had caused me to lose my memory, and for years after that day, I believed the man's tale of the Orcs' secret weapon. But one day, like a flash of light, the memory of what I had done came back to me.≺Prompt≻
Because I had drawn that blade, not only my family, but thousands upon thousands of innocent lives, were lost.≺Prompt≻

From that day forth, I made a pledge to myself that I would not rest until I had found Lightbringer and returned her to her proper place. Only then would I be worthy to die and retreat to the hell that I deserve.≺Prompt≻
Truly unbelievable...≺Prompt≻
I see... So San d'Oria's plan to lure the beastman forces to Tavnazia worked because they were drawn to Lightbringer.≺Prompt≻
But...why were you able to survive the explosion?≺Prompt≻

While running back to the city, I came across a patch of beautiful dreamroses, and remembered my sister. I do not know why, but I picked one and put it in my breast pocket. I feel that is what might have saved me.≺Prompt≻
However, the legend of Ranperre tells of how the Dragon King used Lightbringer to bring peace to San d'Oria. How could such an instrument of good bring so much evil?≺Prompt≻
That, I do not know--though I feel that perhaps Lightbringer was not meant for us.≺Prompt≻
We shall return it to the late king and let him decide its fate.≺Prompt≻
I agree. And I have the perfect citizen to help carry out the task.≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻, you are well-versed in the layout of King Ranperre's Tomb. I ask you to travel there in advance and rid the area of any evil that could endanger the task at hand.≺Prompt≻
I have a feeling that the Orcs may pay us another unexpected visit.≺Prompt≻
Proceed to King Ranperre's Tomb with caution. We must be on our guard until Lightbringer has been returned to its proper resting place.≺Prompt≻

≺Player Name≻. I never thought I would live to see the day when the Royal Knights would fight alongside adventurers such as yourself. Your valiant efforts on the battlefield helped turn the tide in favor of San d'Oria.≺Prompt≻
To protect the prince while grappling with the enemy... I feel that even I may not have been able to accomplish such a feat. I applaud your skill.≺Prompt≻
Our mission is finally over... I feel that sometimes we soldiers forget the frailty of life until we see it lost before our eyes on the battlefield.≺Prompt≻

However, that gives us all the more reason to continue the fight. We cannot let those who have parted with us be forgotten. If you can spare a moment, journey to the cathedral and offer a prayer for the souls that gave their lives for the glory of the Kingdom.≺Prompt≻
Oh, ≺Player Name≻, we have been waiting for your arrival. His Highness is about give an address. Please take your position.≺Prompt≻
I know that your bodies still ache from our recent encounter with the Orcs.≺Prompt≻
However, I require your utmost attention, for I have an important announcement.≺Prompt≻

I have decided that it is in the best interest of the Kingdom to prolong the Rites of Succession indefinitely. My sons still have much to learn of ruling a kingdom. Furthermore, when the time comes for me to step down, if I find my sons inadequate, I will not hesitate in selecting an heir from outside the d'Oraguille family.≺Prompt≻

It is not only the royal family, but others like ≺Player Name≻, that have silently supported San d'Oria for the past twenty years. Perhaps it is an adventurer such as ≺Multiple Choice (Player Gender)≻[he/she] that would be best suited for the throne.≺Prompt≻
The arrogance of the Elvaan has held back this country for much too long. From today forth, we shall recognize our fellow races and join hands with them to form a stronger, better kingdom.≺Prompt≻

≺Player Name≻. I am aware of the hardships you have had to face at the request of your country. However, you must realize that without your undying loyalty to the Kingdom, we would never have been able to realize our erring ways.≺Prompt≻

While simple items cannot express the gratitude this kingdom owes you, I hope you will accept this ≺Possible Special Code: 01≻≺Possible Special Code: 05≻#≺BAD CHAR: 8280≻≺BAD CHAR: 80≻≺BAD CHAR: 80≻ with my blessing.≺Prompt≻
We can hold our heads high knowing that there are adventurers such as ≺Player Name≻, willing to risk their lives for the good of the Kingdom.≺Prompt≻
Now it is the time for the citizens of San d'Oria to do their part.≺Prompt≻
Thanks to your efforts, the chateau regained that sense of peacefulness that it had lacked for so long.≺Prompt≻
I may have been strict with you when you were still a fledgling adventurer. However, I wish for you to forget all that. I now hold nothing but the uttermost respect for you.≺Prompt≻
There is still much work to be done, but you may leave that to us. We do not wish to hold you back from new adventures that await you.≺Prompt≻
Now that Lightbringer has been sealed in the Dragon King's tomb, the Orcs' activity has begun to dwindle. We will shortly be sending soldiers to rid the land of the remaining hordes.≺Prompt≻
As much as your presence on the front line would be welcomed, we cannot run to you to solve all our national crises.≺Prompt≻
However, I expect that one day the Kingdom may again require your services. But until that day, may the light of the Goddess shine down upon you!≺Prompt≻

The conflict with the Orcs may be finally coming to an end, but I doubt that instant peace will follow. We Temple Knights must remain alert at all times, lest danger rear its head within the boundaries of our noble kingdom.≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻, would you not consider joining our ranks? You have much untapped potential.≺Prompt≻
Join the Temple Knights? ≺Selection Dialog≻Yes. No.≺Prompt≻
While I am flattered by your enthusiasm, I know that you would not be satisfied if tied down by the duties of the knights. Your place is under the open skies of Vana'diel.≺Prompt≻
As I expected. I know that you would not be satisfied if tied down by the duties of the knights. Your place is under the open skies of Vana'diel.≺Prompt≻
Now go! Adventure awaits!≺Prompt≻
The battle took its toll on us knights. I am relieved there won't be any more expeditions in the near future...but don't tell Sir Rahal I said that.≺Prompt≻
Lady Curilla and the Temple Knights have found Lightbringer... Who would've thought that it would have been found in such a place? ≺Prompt≻
We knights must keep our senses sharp and our blades sharper. If we let either dull, it could mean our lives!≺Prompt≻
The battle at Fei'Yin dealt a fierce blow to the Orcs. I think that now is the time to finish those fiends off once and for all. The day of peace is finally here!≺Prompt≻
The defeat of the Shadow Lord should improve the situation in the Northlands and improve our odds in the war with the Orcs.≺Prompt≻
There's not a knight in San d'Oria that doesn't wish to take Lightbringer in his hands. However, there are still many mysteries that surround it...≺Prompt≻
It's now time to show those Orcs the true force of the Royal Knights. The battle will go down in history as the day we put an end to their fiendish plots!≺Prompt≻
When I was in the Northlands, I didn't know if I would ever be back here, sipping tea in the comforts of my quarters. I raise my glass to my colleagues who were not as fortunate...≺Prompt≻
I never knew His Highness felt that way about the Kingdom... To put the stability of the country ahead of bloodlines and tradition...the royaulais is truly a great leader.≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻, you have my gratitude for saving my life in the Qu'Bia Arena.≺Prompt≻

The Royal Knights have driven the Orcs into a corner. Our conflict with fiends will soon be resolved. As much as I wish to stand on the frontline with my fellow soldiers, I have many new responsibilities to face here in the chateau.≺Prompt≻
I may, once again, require your services. Until then, may the Goddess shine Her glory upon you in your travels.≺Prompt≻
As my father stated, you may be more suited than I to rule our kingdom...≺Prompt≻
However, whether or not I ever stand at the pinnacle of San d'Oria is not important. This situation with Rochefogne, Lightbringer, and the Orcs has taught me much of what I lack as a leader.≺Prompt≻
Far too often I have relied on your bravery and loyalty. If it were not for your gallant actions, I would have surely perished in the Northlands.≺Prompt≻
If your journeys ever bring you back here to San d'Oria, you will always be welcome. Not as an adventurer, but as a friend.≺Prompt≻
I have heard from my brother of your bravery in Fei'Yin.≺Prompt≻
Your success on the battlefield never ceases to amaze me. There is much I could learn from you...≺Prompt≻
I applaud you on the completion of this mission, as well as apologize for constantly weighing your adventures down with new responsibilities.≺Prompt≻
However, your accomplishments have been, and will be, crucial for the prosperity of the Kingdom. I can sense that your love for San d'Oria is great.≺Prompt≻
Not lending our ears to the thoughts and opinions of others, only thinking that we are correct...≺Prompt≻
However, I now realize that this is the sin we Elvaan are guilty of... That is why I ask of you to guide us. If you feel there is an error in our ways, do not hesitate to inform us.≺Prompt≻
I will use your words to shape this country into a land that you, or your children, or your children's children will not be ashamed of.≺Prompt≻

I apologize for the interruption. However, my offer remains. If you wish to continue with your training in the way of the sword, I will assist. The knights may seem to think differently, but I assure you you need not worry.≺Prompt≻
Take this sword. It will bless you with its power until it senses that your skills have matured. Only then you will be ready to learn the final technique.≺Prompt≻

Positive was I of your answer before you even spoke it. I can sense your desire for knowledge and power.≺Prompt≻

When you feel that the sword has recognized your might, return to me with the weakened blade. I will judge whether or not your journey is over.≺Prompt≻
However, that is when the true trial will begin... I wish you luck, but you must remember it is not luck, but skill and perseverance, that will lead you back to this hall.≺Prompt≻
So there is still doubt in your heart. Irresolution can be a deadly thing on the battlefield. I advise you purge yourself of this trait before setting out on any more adventures.≺Prompt≻

If you do not wish to join their ranks, return here, and I will reconsider your training. I believe that you will make the correct decision.≺Prompt≻
Ah yes, this sword sings of your strength and courageousness. I can see that you are ready for any challenge put forth before you.≺Prompt≻

I applaud you in your completion of the trial. You now have acquired enough skill to wield the final technique.≺Prompt≻
However, you must not be content. I still feel that you are not yet ready for the grueling challenges that await you at the tourneys.≺Prompt≻
I remember when I took part in the competition. I wanted to prove my power to the Kingdom. I wanted to prove that there was no one who could match me...≺Prompt≻
However, that display was only a measure of how weak I actually was...≺Prompt≻

During the championship match, I was possessed with the lust for victory. That lust powered me, and when I brought down my blade onto Prince Trion, the force was so great that it shattered his weapon.≺Prompt≻

But as it shattered, a piece of the broken sword flew into my left eye, darkening it for eternity. While I did not lose my life, I had lost something just as important to a knight--my eyesight.≺Prompt≻

Though I did not let this stand in my way. I continued my training, and just like you, acquired the final technique. And through my training, I learned to rely on more than that which reflects in the eye. I learned to feel what lies in my opponent's heart...≺Prompt≻
I see that the battle between you and my brother is still being waged.≺Prompt≻

...! I apologize for my tardiness! It will never happen again!≺Prompt≻
It seems as if you remain weighted down by the burdens you have placed upon your conscience.≺Prompt≻

I know what those words mean. I know exactly what they mean...≺Prompt≻

However, every time I take up my sword, I can feel the dull, throbbing pain it brings to my soul.≺Prompt≻

I do not wish for you to make the same mistake as I... I apologize, but I have decided not to recommend you for the tourneys. I am sure there are other adventures more worthy of your newfound skill than a foolish game. I wish you all the best in your journeys, ≺Player Name≻.≺Prompt≻
You have learned the weapon skill “Savage Blade”!≺Prompt≻
Ah, adventurer. I was told of your cooperation in apprehending the thief.≺Prompt≻

Come with me.≺Prompt≻
Two years after his defeat at the Second Battle of Konschtat, King Raigegue massed his remaining knights in La Theine and awaited an opportunity to retaliate against Bastok.≺Prompt≻
It was as you say.≺Prompt≻

However, seizing upon his brother's absence, Prince Fellenant mobilized the Temple Knights and took control of the city of San d'Oria. He demanded a peace treaty be drawn up with Bastok, correct?≺Prompt≻
That is correct.≺Prompt≻

Fearing an internecine war, the king decided to send the Scepter Royaulais to Prince Fellenant and abdicate in his favor. His only condition was that the city be released from military control.≺Prompt≻
Yes, we were on our way to bring the scepter to Prince Fellenant.≺Prompt≻

Do you not know even this? It is a beautiful scepter with a rare jewel known as the Pierre Errante set at its end. It requires the most careful handling so as not to mar the stone.≺Prompt≻
...≺Prompt≻
Will you accept my words as truth now? You must allow me audience with Prince Fellenant.≺Prompt≻

Then simply wait for the arrival of the Royal Knights who traveled with me--the Cardinal Stags! We were separated in Ordelle's Caves, but they should be arriving in the city at any moment.≺Prompt≻

Well, isn't that interesting? Captain Guichantmarge of the Cardinal Stags is a good friend of mine, and I have no recollection of seeing your face among his troops when I performed an inspection. Neither do I recall hearing of any new recruits.≺Prompt≻
Surely you jest, sir!≺Prompt≻
The Captain of the Cardinal Stags, as all should know, is Sir Plieucherot. Enough of these games!≺Prompt≻
Monarlais Halver, what are we to do with this individual?≺Prompt≻

He is obviously not the person shown in the sketch we have of the thief, nor do the guards of the royal treasury recognize him as the criminal. We cannot throw him into a cell merely because he has knowledge of the Scepter Royaulais.≺Prompt≻
Yet word of that other matter has not leaked beyond our walls. Are we to just let this man go...?≺Prompt≻
Hmmm... However, I do not believe this fool would have had the finesse required to slip into the treasury. It was open for but a few moments when we removed that other object...≺Prompt≻
My sincerest apologies, sir. We were taken completely unawares. Only one who had extensive knowledge of the castle could have evaded us in such a way... It was no ordinary burglar.≺Prompt≻
Do you still doubt me? I am here on orders from the king. Or is this how the prince treats envoys that appear on his doorstep?≺Prompt≻
Remove him from the chateau. I have not the time nor the patience to deal with his delusions.≺Prompt≻
Sir.≺Prompt≻
I am under orders from the king... What are you...? Release me at once!≺Prompt≻
Mark my words! I, Vijartal Caphieux, have been insulted too many times this day! Your apologies will fall on deaf ears when next we meet!≺Prompt≻
Wait one moment... What did you just say?≺Prompt≻
I said to remember the name of Vijartal Caphieux! I will never forget the disgraces I was forced to endure at your hands!≺Prompt≻
This is an outrage!≺Prompt≻
The name of the revered hero of San d'Oria used in vain by this common bandit! Have you no honor!?≺Prompt≻
What is this you speak of?≺Prompt≻
Simpleton! That is the name of the great man who ended the war between the Royal and Temple Knights two hundred years ago! Even a child would not tell such a scandalous lie!≺Prompt≻
Get out of my sight! The next time you show your face in my presence, I will not be held responsible for my actions!≺Prompt≻

I am sorry, but I cannot pay you a reward. He is not the man we are looking for.≺Prompt≻

Give that gate guard a message for me: he still has a chance to prove himself.≺Prompt≻
Ah, ≺Player Name≻! I require your keen eye and tireless endurance in a most important matter!≺Prompt≻
You see, I was speaking with His Majesty just the other day...≺Prompt≻
You sent for me, Your Majesty?≺Prompt≻
Halver, it is most troublesome. There is something I must confer with you about. Nay, rather I have a request for you.≺Prompt≻
Yes, Your Majesty?≺Prompt≻
Ahem. Well, how do I begin? Do you recall the day when my beloved Leaute first came to the chateau?≺Prompt≻
Why, of course. The chateau was buzzing with rumors of the lovely Tavnazian princess that was destined to be our next queen.≺Prompt≻

I managed to view Queen Leaute's fair profile from the gathered crowd. That image is still burned into my mind even now.≺Prompt≻
I never dreamed that I would end up working so closely with the beautiful princess I saw that day. Queen Leaute would always smile and have a kind word for me...≺Prompt≻

We shall perform the introductions immediately. Come with me, and be on your best behavior.≺Prompt≻
Not that you need overly worry. In private Prince Trion is a gentle soul, quite different from the stern face he presents to the world.≺Prompt≻
Prince Trion!≺Prompt≻
Hm? Oh, it's you, Halver. So rare to see you in this part of the chateau. Is there something that needs my attention?≺Prompt≻
Yes, Your Highness. There is a lady I would like you to meet...≺Prompt≻
A lady...? You mean a new guard for the courtyard, or some such?≺Prompt≻
Ah, not exactly. If Your Highness would care to cast an eye this way?≺Prompt≻
...≺Prompt≻
And your appraisal, Your Highness?≺Prompt≻
She appears to be an adventurer...?≺Prompt≻
Yes, an adventurer hand-picked from the crowd, based on your preferences.≺Prompt≻
My preferences? Halver, what in blazes are you talking about?≺Prompt≻
You see, that is... I have found a lady suited to the Prince's tastes. His Majesty mentioned that you have reached an age where marriage should be a serious consideration.≺Prompt≻
There is no need to be shy. Why not take a stroll around the gardens and become acquainted with one another? We will take our leave.≺Prompt≻
So this is Father's doing... I do not recall speaking of my “preferences” to anyone, however...≺Prompt≻
Prince Trion, you sent for me?≺Prompt≻
C-Curilla...? What are you doing here?≺Prompt≻
I was informed by Prince Pieuje that Your Highness wished to see me...≺Prompt≻
What is the matter with you, Curilla? Can you not read the situation here!? Prince Trion and the lady here are on a “date.” Your presence is not required.≺Prompt≻
A “date”?≺Prompt≻
!!!≺Prompt≻
You mean, Prince Trion and that girl are...?≺Prompt≻
Yes, this may lead to a royal wedding. It would be best if we were to find pressing duties elsewhere.≺Prompt≻

I humbly apologize for this intrusion, Your Highness. If there is nothing further, I shall return to my training. I need complete concentration to practice my sword techniques and would prefer not to be disturbed.≺Prompt≻
Wait! Curilla...! This is not what you...!≺Prompt≻
Finally, you two can spend some time together in peace.≺Prompt≻
Halver...≺Prompt≻
Please, Prince Trion, your gratitude should go to this adventurer. I am merely the messenger.≺Prompt≻
Remove yourself from my presence right this minute, or your blood will stain my fist!≺Prompt≻
Your Highness...? Is there something amiss?≺Prompt≻
Silence! Get out of here, all of you! Halver! I never want to see your miserable face again!≺Prompt≻
I have no idea why Prince Trion was so furious.≺Prompt≻
Hahaha. This may just be the spur Trion needs.≺Prompt≻
I do feel sorry for the Temple Knight who draws Curilla as a fencing partner, however.≺Prompt≻
Unfortunately, it appears that Prince Trion was not pleased with our young lady. Do not take it to heart, as there is no accounting for taste, now is there?≺Prompt≻

The minstrel of melodies is my name, For a mere ≺Numeric Parameter 6≻ gil I'll recall your past. Your stories of love, anger, triumph, and shame, The river of memories runs deep and vast.≺Prompt≻
The minstrel of melodies is my name, For a mere ≺Numeric Parameter 6≻ gil I'd recall your past. But I find that you're lacking in cash or in fame, So until that time, my kind offer will last.≺Prompt≻
Now close your eyes...≺Prompt≻
Ah, ≺Player Name≻! I am delighted to see you have shown interest in our fine exercise.≺Prompt≻
I can assume you have already been informed of the finer details of Conflict, can I not?≺Prompt≻

The three nations are finally at peace. Tension between the people of Vana'diel is the last thing any of us wish. However, while only a simple exercise, a game such as Ballista could be misinterpreted by some as a direct attack on an ally.≺Prompt≻

That is where you adventurers come in. Your minds are still clear, your spirits fresh. You are not controlled by petty politics and hidden agendas. It is you who have the opportunity to become the true heroes of the Kingdom.≺Prompt≻
Ah, but to think I would live to see the day Conflict was reinstated. Just thinking of the heated battle makes my heart race with excitement.≺Prompt≻
When I was still young, I would spend my days training for Ballista with my fellow knights. Victory was the only thing on our minds.≺Prompt≻
Knowing thy enemy and using that knowledge to strike him down... Giving your all till you have no more to give... The power of the spirit is what drives us, young ≺Player Name≻.≺Prompt≻
And when the battle is through, there remains no hate nor spite--only a bond between brothers that can be experienced through the silent, firm handshake exchanged before parting.≺Prompt≻
You have my permission to take part in the games. My only regret is that due to my age, I will be unable to fight by your side.≺Prompt≻
However, forget not during these exercises you will be bearing the emblem of the Kingdom. The honor of San d'Oria is at stake, so act accordingly.≺Prompt≻
Defeat is not an option. I expect you to do your best, and I expect you to win.≺Prompt≻
Hmmm...≺Prompt≻
So you are the adventurer known as ≺Player Name≻. It has come to my attention that you wish to participate in our battle exercises.≺Prompt≻
Step closer and show me your face.≺Prompt≻
...≺Prompt≻
Hah hah hah! You truly do not think you can defeat my legions of seasoned fighters, do you?≺Prompt≻

When I learned that adventurers from Bastok would be taking part in Conflict, I was looking forward to seeing what kind of brute warrior the Republic would send. But if this is all my Hume companions have to offer, I can be only more positive that the forces of San d'Oria will be victorious.≺Prompt≻
In recent years our two nations have been on amicable terms. However, I do not feel that any of my loyal citizens have forgotten what transpired in the Konschtat Highlands.≺Prompt≻

When I learned that adventurers from Windurst would be taking part in Conflict, I was looking forward to seeing what kind of mighty sorcerer the Federation would send. But if this is all my Tarutaru companions have to offer, I can be only more positive that the forces of San d'Oria will be victorious.≺Prompt≻
In recent years San d'Oria and Windurst have been on amicable terms. However, I do not feel that any of my loyal citizens have forgotten the bitter history that stains our nations' past.≺Prompt≻

Ballista is the perfect opportunity to help erase the unwanted feelings of spite between us. But this does not mean my Kingdom's forces will show pity to their opponents. I will grant you the opportunity to withdraw your participation, if you wish.≺Prompt≻
...I see that you have already made up your mind.≺Prompt≻
Understood. Speak with Excenmille in Northern San d'Oria. There you will receive your Conflict registration.≺Prompt≻
You may have had success in previous battles, but the road that lies ahead is like nothing you have traveled before. Clear your heart and cast off all inhibitions, and you will go far.≺Prompt≻
I wish you and your nation luck, ≺Player Name≻.≺Prompt≻

What would you like to know about? ≺Selection Dialog≻Basic rules. Official/private matches. Flammen-Brenner. Flamme. Match score. Petras and quarrying. Sprint. KO. Return.≺Prompt≻
The basic rules of Brenner are as follows:≺Prompt≻
First, the participants divide into two teams. Each side's camp contains the same number of “Flammen-Brenner.”≺Prompt≻
At the beginning of the match, half of each side's Flammen-Brenner will be ablaze with “Flamme,” or flame, while the other half will remain unlit.≺Prompt≻
Participants can seize a Flamme from the opposing side's Flammen-Brenner and carry it around the Isle.≺Prompt≻
The goal is to steal your opponent's Flamme and use them to light your side's Flammen-Brenner.≺Prompt≻
The side that succeeds in lighting all of its Flammen-Brenner will be declared the winner after a specified amount of time.≺Prompt≻
If neither side is victorious before the match ends, the outcome will be judged based on the score. The “match score” section of the rulebook contains more information on this subject.≺Prompt≻
Brenner is significantly divided into public and private matches. Official matches are held periodically according to level and feature general participation.≺Prompt≻
You cannot reserve the Isle when an official match is being held.≺Prompt≻
No items are necessary for participation, but a minor fee will be collected. You will be unable to participate if your level is too low.≺Prompt≻

The match outcome will be recorded unless the number of participants fails to exceed ≺Numeric Parameter 0≻ members, or if there are fewer than ≺Numeric Parameter 1≻ members in a match where the two sides' numbers differ. In such cases, the game will be considered a training match and will not be recorded.≺Prompt≻
Private matches require a reservation, and participation may be limited. The ≺Set Color #5≻Master of Ceremonies≺Set Color #1≻ (MC) can freely adjust the rules and control match proceedings.≺Prompt≻
“LS Liga” is a form of private match. You can learn more about LS Liga by speaking to a Marshal.≺Prompt≻
A Flammen-Brenner is a device that contains a Flamme (flame). The Flammen-Brenner is covered by a grate that will open after taking a set amount of damage, exposing the Flamme.≺Prompt≻
The participants must utilize this chance to seize the Flamme before the grate recloses. Once the grate is closed, the Flammen-Brenner will begin recovering from the damage it has been dealt.≺Prompt≻
If you manage to open the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner and capture their Flamme, you should make haste to light one of the Flammen-Brenner on your side.≺Prompt≻
After a certain amount of time, the Flamme will burn out and the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner will be relit.≺Prompt≻
Also, please note that you cannot quicken your pace using any special abilities while you are in possession of a Flamme.≺Prompt≻
In the event that neither side fulfills the conditions for victory, the outcome of the match will be evaluated based on score.≺Prompt≻

Ten points are awarded to each side for every lit Flammen-Brenner, while one point is awarded whenever a Flamme is captured, used to light a Flammen-Brenner, or recaptured from an opponent. One point is also awarded for protecting the Flammen-Brenner for a certain period of time.≺Prompt≻

Like Ballista, ≺Set Color #5≻quarry≺Set Color #1≻ (/quarry) can be used while playing Brenner. Participants may use this ability to dig up ≺Set Color #5≻Petras≺Set Color #1≻ and temporary items.≺Prompt≻

However, unlike Ballista Petras, Brenner Petras have no effect on the match score. You can ≺Set Color #5≻trade≺Set Color #1≻ a Petra to a Pursuivant to recover your HP and MP at no expense to TP.≺Prompt≻
≺Set Color #5≻Sprint≺Set Color #1≻ cannot be used while carrying a Petra. Also, please note that the ≺Set Color #5≻scout≺Set Color #1≻ ability cannot be used in Brenner.≺Prompt≻
Petras will be lost in the event of a KO, but can be carried over from one match to another.≺Prompt≻
The ≺Set Color #5≻sprint≺Set Color #1≻ (/sprint) ability can be used to increase the player's speed when not in possession of a Flamme or Petras.≺Prompt≻
In the event of a KO, you will be returned to your team's camp. However, recovery will take longer the more often you fall in battle.≺Prompt≻
In other words, you will receive a penalty if you fall immediately after recovering from KO. In addition, your TP will be reduced to zero and you will lose any Petras in your possession.≺Prompt≻

Those ties persist to this day, and we yet maintain a perfunctory level of international diplomacy. All manner of information makes its way to my ears.≺Prompt≻

That one there with the large flowers is such a specimen. I hear they enhance the blooms with alchemical processes.≺Prompt≻
Ever since that recruiter from Aht Urhgan arrived, the chateau has been in an uproar. Especially Prince Tri--≺Prompt≻

Hmmm. I had heard that the Empire of Aht Urhgan was desperately recruiting mercenaries, but to see one of their insignias with my own eyes...≺Prompt≻
≺Player Name≻, you have become a mercenary, have you not?≺Prompt≻

That is when I had Travialce here shadow the prince's movements. He has had training in the arts of the ninja.≺Prompt≻

Sir. Prince Trion first made his way to Mhaura and passed himself off as an adventurer.≺Prompt≻

The court will be mortified.≺Prompt≻
From there, His Highness boarded a ferry bound for the shores of Aht Urhgan...≺Prompt≻
Aht Urhgan!? And then?≺Prompt≻
I quickly slipped aboard as well, and guarded the royal person from the shadows.≺Prompt≻
The ferry safely arrived in Al Zahbi with the prince none the wiser of my presence.≺Prompt≻
After entering the city, Prince Trion headed straight to a mercenary company and apparently signed some sort of contract.≺Prompt≻

First, we must learn the reason for Prince Trion's seemingly frequent trips to the nation of Aht Urhgan.≺Prompt≻

Do not be concerned.≺Prompt≻

Four years ago, Jalzahn, the former Emperor of Aht Urhgan, and his wife both succumbed to the same illness...≺Prompt≻
Yes, I remember... The Kingdom of San d'Oria sent her condolences. The illness was quite virulent, as I recall...≺Prompt≻
The beastmen who dwell on the western borders of the nation used this as an opportunity to cease offering tributes.≺Prompt≻
Hmph. What more would you expect from those savages?≺Prompt≻
Though the Empire's long war with the eastern nations was at a stalemate, they could not afford to grow complacent.≺Prompt≻
The main body of the Imperial Army remained focused on the east...≺Prompt≻

Meanwhile, the beastmen of the Mamool Ja Savagelands and Halvung Territory unfurled a banner of rebellion on the abandoned western front. It was not long before they were joined by an army known as the “Undead Swarm”...≺Prompt≻
The military might of San d'Oria is fully occupied with the Orcish horde alone. If it were three separate armies...≺Prompt≻
Even a mighty nation like Aht Urhgan must flounder...≺Prompt≻
Of a certain, sir. The capital itself has recently been the target of beastman invasions.≺Prompt≻
Aht Urhgan now finds herself without the resources to even repair the walls of Al Zahbi...≺Prompt≻
No matter how impressive a swordsman Prince Trion is, we cannot allow him to remain in such a dangerous place.≺Prompt≻
I must take this matter up with those responsible for protecting the royal household.≺Prompt≻

It is good that you recognize your failings, but you shall be made to take responsibility for this situation.≺Prompt≻

?≺Prompt≻

Well met, friend. I am Temple Knight Rembard. My duty is the issuance of marriage certificates to lawfully wedded couples.≺Prompt≻
How may I serve you this day?≺Prompt≻
Marriage certificates are legally binding documents issued in recognition of the matrimony of the two individuals named therein. They may also adorn the wall of your Mog House.≺Prompt≻
Those wishing to receive this document must present proof of their marriage in the manner I shall now explain.≺Prompt≻

The couple should form a party while the husband is equipped with his ≺Set Color #5≻matrimony ring≺Set Color #1≻, and his wife, her ≺Set Color #5≻matrimony band≺Set Color #1≻. Thence, speak to me, and I shall prepare the certificates without delay.≺Prompt≻
Alternatively, should you have a ≺Set Color #5≻wedding ring≺Set Color #1≻ in your possession, it is possible to request issuance without your partner present.≺Prompt≻

Please bear in the mind, though, that one person cannot possess multiple certificates at any given time. Furthermore, the nation of issuance for the certificate you hold cannot differ from that of your spouse.≺Prompt≻
Lastly, the re-issuance of a misplaced certificate can be carried out solely by the officiating body wherefrom it was originally issued.≺Prompt≻
A wedding is a joyous event wherein two souls brought together by fate are joined in an everlasting union.≺Prompt≻
San d'Orian tradition holds that the bride and groom, each with weapon in hand, swear an oath of lifelong loyalty to each other before the goddess Altana.≺Prompt≻
Wedding rings--a ≺Set Color #5≻matrimony ring≺Set Color #1≻ and a ≺Set Color #5≻matrimony band≺Set Color #1≻, to be precise--are required.≺Prompt≻
These rings, which require rare and ofttimes elusive ingredients for synthesis, symbolize a couple's undying devotion to each other.≺Prompt≻
Prior to presenting the ring to your partner, it is common practice to engrave one's name onto it using such items as ≺Set Color #5≻cyclone crystals≺Set Color #1≻.≺Prompt≻
≺Set Color #5≻Wedding dresses≺Set Color #1≻ and ≺Set Color #5≻benedight coats≺Set Color #1≻ popularly serve as ceremonial attire for men and women, respectively.≺Prompt≻

While garments like in form and function can be synthesized, the procurement of ingredients to make them presents quite a challenge. It is precisely for this reason, however, that significance is lent to their donning in ceremonies. Some adventurers perform the synthesis themselves, while others prefer to entrust the task to a friend.≺Prompt≻
Be not disheartened, though, should the garments be not within your means. No law dictates how couples must attire themselves in a wedding ceremony.≺Prompt≻
Should you encounter difficulty obtaining any of the ceremonial items mentioned thus far, they can also be purchased from the chests you see before you.≺Prompt≻
Such items as fireworks and ≺Set Color #5≻wedding bells≺Set Color #1≻ are also available to assist you in enhancing the atmosphere of revelry. You may purchase them as you see fit.≺Prompt≻
